title: President
tasks: Executive management (i.e. top management),Policy analysis,Scientific research,Project management,Other (please explain in the text box): Ideas and Engineering
location: San Leandro,San Mateo,San Francisquito,Santa Clara Valley,Mowry,Stevens,Mission - Islais,Yosemite - Visitacion,San Lorenzo
agree: NA
science: Other (please explain in the text box): Start seriously planning projects that can keep up with the worst predictions of sea level rise.  South San Francisco Bay is a unique opportunity.  You can get the rest of the Bay complaining they are not within its protection.  The dike is easily funded as an alternative to flood insurance.  The food productivity of restoring the old fisheries helps pay for the structure.  The dike creates more real estate to pay for itself.
info: Sea level rise projections,Other (please explain in the text box): We propose a dike approximately under the Bay Bridge.  Perhaps a mile wide.  Built to keep rising as sea level rises even to 60 meters.  Initially using tidal power to flush the South Bay and restore its oyster, herring, and other fisheries to 1900's levels.  Pump down (pause at low tide) ahead of rain storms to prevent rain storm flooding all around the South Bay.  The dike and complete fisheries restoration is less expensive than increased flood insurance, and therefore can be voluntarily as "lower cost flood insurance."  Ask for our Bay Area Challenge entry.  Way better long-term adaptation than Bay Area Challenge winners.
impact: They are starting to be felt right now
policy: Other (please explain), Establish a South Bay regional authority to build the dike.  The economics work very well for the South Bay by itself.  The South Bay has the most urgency combined with a containable amount of rain flood water.  This action then galvanizes other areas around the Bay.
collabActivities: Carrying out research projects jointly with other organizations,Preparing grant/funding proposals jointly with other organizations,Other (please specify): Ask for our Bay Area Challenge entry
barriers: Other (please explain): Funded by ARPA-E's MARINER project to work the fisheries restoration angle big-time.
missing_collaborators: Any with the long-term perspective to run with the dike.  We have moved to global food, energy, and ocean restoration.
